Sr. Business Analyst (Job Description) Our client (NYCERS) is seeking an experienced Business Analyst to join our team as we undertake major changes in the software we use. This position straddles both the business and technical realms. The selected candidate will work closely with the product owner to: Prioritize & manage product backlog Understand customer/user needs to define clear feature requirements, userstories and acceptance criteria Translate business needs into requirements for a technical audience, including creating user stories, synthesizing use cases, defining acceptance criteria, and documenting feature overviews Implement lesson learned to optimize product efficiencies throughout product lifecycle Analyze customer feedback and data to identify important issues that need to be addressed Prioritize and coordinate tasks, monitor progress, help resolve issues, and facilitate team meetings Understand “Current state” to develop “Future state” requirements and designs Perform GAP analysis and develop recommendations to guide decision makingand product design Participate in and support interactions with clients to collect businessrequirements and drive product adoption Coordinate and assist in the testing of new products and features Facilitate and lead cross functional process review and solution design sessions Specific responsibilities: Write and review user stories Create user journey map, persona, story map, process, data, and system flowdiagrams Participate in Sprint Demos Contribute on all phases of development life cycle Assist in UAT Product validations (e.g. define test strategies, test conditions,expected results, test plans, and test scripts) Understand business processes and needs Elicit requirements Create Business Requirements Documents (BRDs) Actively develop and maintain strong working relationships with all stakeholders both at an interpersonal level and across all business processes within the wider business environment. Actively maintain communication and behavior standards that foster a culture of strong customer and service excellence with all stakeholders. Mandatory Requirements: 8+ years’ experience as a Business Analyst Strong analytical skills; ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, recommendations, and drive business decisions Strengths in problem solving, issue-resolution, with a demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities in an agile development environment Ability to manage the work from teams of widely varying skills and levels Excellent verbal and written communication skills and great attention todetail Ability to translate business needs into technical requirements fordevelopment Must be able to translate technical specifications into functional requirements. Experience in complex workflow development projects with expertise in Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) using the Waterfall and/or Agile methodology Familiarity with Agile development processes and JIRA Advanced skills in Microsoft Word, Project, Excel, Visio & PowerPoint. Manage multiple competing priorities of varying complexities througheffective organization and communication while meeting deadlines, andworking well under pressure. Passionate about work, self-motivated, high-energy, detail oriented, results-driven performer with excellent problem solving abilities. Must have superb communication skills and be able to effectivelycommunicate complex analytical results, both written and verbally, in a clear and easy-to-understand manner with people regardless of their technical skill set. Must have excellent interpersonal, communication, presentation, writing, analytical, problem solving, information gathering, and customer service skills. Ability to work independently on strategic issues with users. Good understanding in Human Factor as it relates to user friendly design ofinterfaces, maximize usability, and improvement of worker efficiency.
